criteria: Accuracy of Translation of Quantitative/Technical Information
Clarity and Precision in Representing Information
Effective Use of Visual Form (Tables, Charts, etc.) or Language
descriptions: No attempt to translate or the translation is completely inaccurate and incomprehensible.
The translation shows a minimal understanding, with significant inaccuracies and omissions.
The translation captures some key elements but contains several inaccuracies or lacks clarity in certain areas.
The translation is mostly accurate, but some details are missing or slightly misinterpreted.
The translation is accurate and clear, with only minor imperfections.
The translation is exceptionally accurate, comprehensive, and demonstrates a deep understanding of the material.
The visual/verbal representation is confusing, disorganized, and lacks precision.
The visual/verbal representation is difficult to understand and contains significant ambiguities.
The visual/verbal representation is somewhat clear but lacks precision in some areas.
The visual/verbal representation is generally clear and precise, with only minor areas for improvement.
The visual/verbal representation is clear, precise, and easy to understand.
The visual/verbal representation is exceptionally clear, precise, and insightful, enhancing understanding of the information.
The visual form or language used is inappropriate or completely ineffective in conveying the information.
The visual form or language used is poorly chosen and hinders understanding.
The visual form or language used is somewhat effective but could be improved.
The visual form or language used is generally effective in conveying the information.
The visual form or language used is highly effective and enhances understanding.
The visual form or language used is exceptionally effective, creative, and insightful, providing new perspectives on the information.
